full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement: Metallic Powder Storage

#### Project Overview

The National Research Council Canada has a requirement for a project that involves supplying and installing a pure argon fire suppression system for Room S2-011. The contractor will be responsible for providing, installing, and commissioning the system for the storage of metal powders.

#### Mandatory Site Visit

It is mandatory for all bidders to participate in a site visit on either October 12th or 13th, 2022 at 9:00 am. During this visit, a representative from each bidding company must be present and sign an attendance form, as failure to do so will result in their submission being considered non-responsive.

#### Tender Closing Date

The tender closing date is set for October 27th, 2022 at 14:00.

#### Tender Results

After the tender closing date, the contract results will be sent to all contractors who submitted a tender via email.

#### Security Requirements

A security clearance is required for all personnel involved in the project, with a minimum RELIABILITY status level as defined in the security policy of Canada. Bidders must also provide a valid Workplace Safety and Insurance Board (WSIB) certificate with their tender or prior to contract award.

#### Important Documents

Tender packages can be obtained through the Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA services provider. Addenda, when issued, will be available from the same provider. All bidders must ensure that their submissions are based on the tender documents obtained from the Buyandsell.gc.ca TMA service provider, as those obtained from other sources will not be considered for award.

*   Departmental Representative (or designate): Jean-Philippe Jacob, Phone: 450 641-5250, Email: [Jean-Philippe.Jacob@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Jean-Philippe.Jacob@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)
*   Contracting Authority: Collin Long, Email: [Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Collin.Long@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca)
